nodes.bodyText:
why 3?
also it should be configurable
Made configurable.  I made it three in case we're in the middle of a replication change or something else that switches the value.

you could use Stack#getNotDeletedInstanceMetaDataList if you don't need the deleted ones, but if you really need terminated instances I think we should add this stream as a method to Stack as it seems to me we might need it multiple times
I want to report status on all of them.  I'll add it to Stack.
why don't we know which instance we should use?
It's not stored in the stack data, and I haven't been able to determine which one it should be.  If we have multi-master setup, it's not clear which one is the real master.
I think this is something we'll need to add in the next round of HA work.
you should use for (InstanceMetaData instance : instances) as you don't use the index elsewhere
I cannot update the list of instances if using this style for loop.  Per next comment, I add it back to the list to retry since I cannot idx--.
so there is no reason now not to switch to the above format, or am I missing something?
changed.
so you add it to the list to check it again or is it a bug?
Yes.  I add it back to the list to retry because we don't have a proper health yet.
if we get into this branch, shouldn't we exit the for loop?
No because this is just one instance.  If we can't reach one instance, we still need to contact the others to get their status.
the method name doesn't reflect what it does. I think instance.isAvailable() should be in the caller if, and the else branch from there should call the body of this method (wo the if here oc)
changed
refactor into a method pls
refactored
this is not needed anymore I think
removed
